# Ben Zimmermann

> Security researcher specializing in identifying critical failures in large-scale systems. Awarded over $20,000 in bug bounties for securing critical infrastructure and the open web.

Ben is a California-based security researcher with a focus on secret scanning, infrastructure security, and vulnerability disclosure. His work has been featured in TechCrunch and NPR.

## Security Research

- [Home Depot Exposure](https://techcrunch.com/2025/12/12/home-depot-exposed-access-to-internal-systems-for-a-year-says-researcher/): Featured in TechCrunch. A leaked GitHub token granted access to hundreds of private repositories and cloud infrastructure.
- [GitHub Critical Infrastructure](https://github.com/bzzimmy): Awarded $20,000. Discovered a leaked OAuth token granting write access to core repositories.
- [Vue.js Security Hall of Fame](https://github.com/vuejs/core/blob/main/SECURITY.md): Found a leaked Algolia Admin API key with write access to search index.
- [TripAdvisor Data Exposure](https://bzzimmy.com): Awarded $1,500. Identified exposed employee token allowing access to source code and pipelines.

## Projects

- [EasyApex](https://github.com/bzzimmy/easyapex): Automated Chrome extension for solving Apex Learning quizzes using Vision AI.
- [CodePen Scraper](https://github.com/bzzimmy): High-performance GraphQL harvester for secret scanning.
